intro: Coriandrum majus, commonly known as love-in-a-mist, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and delicate, feathery leaves that are finely divided. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in loose, mist-like clusters, which give it its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Coriandrum majus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, aromatic scent.
